liber.edit.client
Class MyDialogBox

java.lang.Object
  PopupPanel
      liber.edit.client.MyDialogBox
Direct Known Subclasses:
BrowsingBox, Help, QueryResult
public class MyDialogBox
extends PopupPanel

A form of popup that has a caption area at the top and can be dragged by the user.

CSS Style Rules

  • .gwt-DialogBox { the outside of the dialog }
  • .gwt-DialogBox .Caption { the caption }

Example

This DialogBox has three buttons at the top that minimise, maximise and close the window.

Constructor Detail

MyDialogBox

public MyDialogBox()
Creates an empty dialog box. It should not be shown until its child widget has been added using #add(Widget).

MyDialogBox

public MyDialogBox(boolean autoHide)
Creates an empty dialog box specifying its "auto-hide" property. It should not be shown until its child widget has been added using #add(Widget).

Parameters:
autoHide - true if the dialog should be automatically hidden when the user clicks outside of it

MyDialogBox

public MyDialogBox(boolean autoHide,
                   boolean modal)
Creates an empty dialog box specifying its "auto-hide" property. It should not be shown until its child widget has been added using #add(Widget).

Parameters:
autoHide - true if the dialog should be automatically hidden when the user clicks outside of it
modal - true if keyboard and mouse events for widgets not contained by the dialog should be ignored
Method Detail

setCloseListener

public void setCloseListener(ClickListener listen)
Sets a listener on the close button

Parameters:
listen - ClickListener

setHeight

public void setHeight(int h)
Sets the height of the window (used by minimise and maximise buttons)

Parameters:
h - Height

setHeight

public void setHeight(int h,
                      boolean store)
Sets the height of the window (used by minimise and maximise buttons). If store is true, store this setting as the proper size. If false, the window is being minimised or maximised, so the old dimensions should be saved to undo it later on.

Parameters:
h - Height
store - If true, store the new height setting

setWidth

public void setWidth(int w)
Sets the width of the window (used by minimise and maximise buttons)

Parameters:
w - width

setWidth

public void setWidth(int w,
                     boolean store)
Sets the width of the window (used by minimise and maximise buttons). If store is true, store this setting as the proper size. If false, the window is being minimised or maximised, so the old dimensions should be saved to undo it later on.

Parameters:
w - Width
store - If true, store the new height setting

setCaptionStyle

public void setCaptionStyle(boolean toWysiwym)
Sets the caption stylename

Parameters:
toWysiwym - True to adopt wysiwym style
